action.action-desc: Mr. Burgess (for himself, Mr. Brady of Texas, Mr. Cole, and Mr. Wenstrup) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide an exception to certain mandatory minimum sentence requirements for a person employed outside the United States by a Federal agency, who uses, carries, or possesses the firearm during and in relation to a crime of violence committed while on-duty with a firearm required to be carried while on-duty.

section.header: Exception to certain mandatory minimum sentencing requirements for person employed outside the United States by a Federal agency, who uses, carries, or possesses a firearm during and in relation to a crime of violence committed while on-duty with a firearm required to be carried while on-duty
section.text: Section 3261 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, if the offense is a violation of section 924(c)(1) of this title, the minimum sentencing requirements of section 924(c)(1)(A) of this title shall not apply ifâ€”

paragraph.text: the person committed a crime of violence during and in relation to the offense;
an agency of the United States required the person to carry a firearm while on-duty; and
at the time the person used, carried, or possessed the firearm, the person was employed outside the United States by the agency, and was on-duty.
